1250135944386265088.text:
This results in a difficult dilemma: our nation’s firefighters, law enforcement, and EMTs confront the most stressful situations when they are on shift, and when they are off, now worry about infecting/exposing their loved ones at home.

The mental burdens they carry are immense.

1250134814692388867.text: First responders can’t choose who they are responding to, or know ahead of time if the individual is carrying #coronavirus or not, so they must now grapple with the constant potential exposure to the virus on a daily basis.

1250134388945362949.text:
But our first responders also contend with higher mental health stress and higher risk for suicide than other professions.

And the stress imposed by the #coronavirus pandemic is only increasing those burdens.

1017163049990524929.text: My office has now helped more than 10,000 people right here in Sacramento County – including nearly 2,500 veterans and servicemembers. 9/

1017162946185781249.text: As a doctor who has helped care for veterans, I know how much our vets sacrifice for our country – it’s so important to support these heroes. 8/

1017162861263679489.text:
It turned out that while Sal was approved for his back pay, the VA had never actually sent his benefits. 

My office contacted the VA to expedite Sal’s benefits and the situation was resolved within a month. 7/

1017162719710064640.text: As the bills mounted, Sal contacted my office to help with his VA disability claim – we got right to work. 6/

1017162644535554053.text: During his second treatment period, the VA had not yet provided Sal with his back-pay benefits, adding to his stress. 5/

1017162566668300291.text: Unfortunately, Sal later received tests that his cancer had returned. It was a very stressful time for Sal and his finances. 4/

1017162485466652674.text: He decided to use his Department of Veterans Affairs benefits to pay for his medicine and started responding positively to treatment. 3/

1017162393418420230.text: Sal was diagnosed with prostate cancer related to his exposure to Agent Orange. 2/

1017162285444468736.text: Meet Sal. Sal is a Carmichael native and an Army veteran who served during the Vietnam War. 1/ https://t.co/nbrG3cfAje

1013952961888825346.text: My office has now helped more than 10,000 people right here in Sacramento County – that includes helping 1,500 residents with Social Security and Medicare issues. 10/

1013952806334730240.text: Rob asked my office that when we shared his story, that we share his advice: “Don’t be afraid to call your representative for help – Stick to the facts and they will do everything they can.” 9/

1013952700109721601.text: Within a few weeks, we were able to help Rob and his wife get a Medicare exemption so their policy could be reinstated. 8/

1013952594975313920.text: Then Rob called my office, and my staff got to work. 7/

1013952460568825856.text: They worried that they’d have to pay for their medications with credit cards, piling up debts that’d place their whole retirement in jeopardy. 6/

1013952336430059520.text: They were told their insurance policy could not be reinstated, and that they’d have to wait several months to get their coverage back. 5/

1013952200433983489.text: But then Rob and his wife received a cancellation notice. It turned out his insurance company was checking the wrong account all along, and his automatic payments had been turned off. 4/

1013952045659795456.text: He called his insurance agent repeatedly, and was assured he’d paid in full. 3/

1013951909840019456.text: They paid for a private insurance plan to supplement their Medicare coverage. But Rob began to receive notices from his insurance company claiming that he owed them money, even though he had set up automatic payments. 2/

1013951729598156800.text: Meet Rob. Rob and his wife have lived in the Sacramento area since 1972. Their Medicare supplemental insurance was cancelled, through no fault of their own. 1/ https://t.co/zZaZDZUsxE

1012068704526401537.text: We followed up with the State Department and learned a mistake was made processing Courtney’s request. 6/

1012068703687634944.text: After hearing Courtney’s story, my office got right to work.  5/

1012068702597074945.text: Needless to say, it was an emotional time for her family. 4/

1012068701020016640.text: She had earlier applied for new passports, but now she needed them much more quickly to go on her trip and she was concerned they wouldn’t arrive in time. 3/

1000457616240373761.text: Unfortunately, Sal later received tests that his cancer had returned. It was a very stressful time for Sal and his finances. During his second treatment period, the VA had not yet provided Sal with his back-pay benefits, adding to his stress. 3/

933153663832526848.text: It turned out that while Sal was approved for his back-pay, the VA had never actually sent his benefits. My office contacted the VA about expediting Sal’s benefits and the situation was resolved within a month. 5/

933153430893465601.text: During this second treatment period, the VA had not yet provided Sal with his back-pay benefits, adding to his stress. As the bills mounted, Sal contacted my office to help with his VA disability claim – we got right to work. 4/

933153212076404736.text: Unfortunately, Sal later received tests that his cancer had returned. It was a very stressful time for Sal and his finances.

933153036951785473.text: He decided to use his Department of Veterans Affairs benefits to pay for his medicine and started responding positively to treatment. 2/
